name: ABS
description: Returns the absolute value of a number

name: CONCAT
description: Concatenates two or more strings together

name: SUBSTR
description: Returns a substring from a string starting at a specified position

name: UPPER
description: Converts a string to uppercase

name: LOWER
description: Converts a string to lowercase

name: TRIM
description: Removes leading and trailing spaces from a string

name: DATE_FORMAT
description: Formats a date according to the specified format

name: COALESCE
description: Returns the first non-null value in a list

name: IFNULL
description: Returns the first argument if it is not NULL, otherwise returns the second argument

name: IF
description: Returns one value if a condition is TRUE, or another value if a condition is FALSE

name: CASE
description: Makes conditional statements like if-then-else

name: CAST
description: Converts a value from one data type to another

name: ROUND
description: Rounds a number to a specified number of decimal places

name: FLOOR
description: Returns the largest integer value less than or equal to a number

name: CEILING
description: Returns the smallest integer value greater than or equal to a number

name: LENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string in bytes

name: CHAR_LENGTH
description: Returns the length of a string in characters

name: DATEDIFF
description: Returns the number of days between two dates

name: TIMESTAMPDIFF
description: Returns the difference between two datetime expressions

name: UUID
description: Returns a Universal Unique Identifier

name: MD5
description: Calculates an MD5 hash value

name: REPLACE
description: Replaces all occurrences of a substring within a string

name: INET_ATON
description: Converts an IPv4 address to numeric value

name: INET_NTOA
description: Converts numeric value to IPv4 address

name: FIND_IN_SET
description: Returns position of string within a comma-separated list

name: FORMAT
description: Formats number to specified decimal places and adds thousand separators

name: FROM_UNIXTIME
description: Converts Unix timestamp to datetime

name: HEX
description: Returns hexadecimal representation of a decimal or string value

name: UNHEX
description: Converts hexadecimal value to string

name: INSTR
description: Returns position of first occurrence of substring in string

name: LCASE
description: Synonym for LOWER()

name: LEFT
description: Returns the leftmost number of characters from string

name: RIGHT
description: Returns the rightmost number of characters from string

name: LPAD
description: Left-pads string with specified characters to certain length

name: RPAD
description: Right-pads string with specified characters to certain length

name: LTRIM
description: Removes leading spaces from string

name: RTRIM
description: Removes trailing spaces from string

name: MAKE_SET
description: Returns set of comma-separated strings that have corresponding bit set

name: POWER
description: Returns the value of number raised to specified power

name: QUOTE
description: Escapes string and adds single quotes

name: REPEAT
description: Repeats a string specified number of times

name: REVERSE
description: Reverses the characters in a string

name: SOUNDEX
description: Returns soundex string of given string

name: SPACE
description: Returns string of specified number of spaces

name: SUBSTRING_INDEX
description: Returns substring from string before specified number of delimiter occurs

name: TIME_FORMAT
description: Formats time according to format specification

name: TIME_TO_SEC
description: Converts time value to seconds

name: SEC_TO_TIME
description: Converts seconds to time value

name: TRUNCATE
description: Truncates number to specified number of decimal places

name: UNIX_TIMESTAMP
description: Returns Unix timestamp

name: WEEKDAY
description: Returns weekday index (0=Monday, 6=Sunday)

name: YEARWEEK
description: Returns year and week number

name: DATE_ADD
description: Adds time/date interval to date

name: DATE_SUB
description: Subtracts time/date interval from date

name: NOW
description: Synonym for CURRENT_TIMESTAMP()

name: DAYNAME
description: Returns name of weekday

name: MONTHNAME
description: Returns name of month

name: QUARTER
description: Returns quarter from date (1 to 4)

name: WEEK
description: Returns week number

name: COUNT
description: Returns the number of rows in a group

name: SUM
description: Returns the sum of values in a group

name: AVG
description: Returns the average of values in a group

name: MIN
description: Returns the minimum value in a group

name: MAX
description: Returns the maximum value in a group

name: GROUP_CONCAT
description: Returns a concatenated string from a group

name: STD
description: Returns the population standard deviation

name: VARIANCE
description: Returns the population variance

name: BIT_AND
description: Returns the bitwise AND of all bits in a group

name: BIT_OR
description: Returns the bitwise OR of all bits in a group

name: BIT_XOR
description: Returns the bitwise XOR of all bits in a group

name: JSON_ARRAYAGG
description: Aggregates result set as JSON array

name: JSON_OBJECTAGG
description: Aggregates result set as JSON object

name: COUNT_DISTINCT
description: Returns count of distinct values in group

name: ROW_NUMBER
description: Returns the sequential number of a row within a partition

name: RANK
description: Returns the rank of current row within a partition, with gaps

name: DENSE_RANK
description: Returns the rank of current row within a partition, without gaps

name: LAG
description: Returns the value from a previous row in the partition

name: LEAD
description: Returns the value from a following row in the partition

name: FIRST_VALUE
description: Returns the first value in the window frame

name: LAST_VALUE
description: Returns the last value in the window frame

name: NTH_VALUE
description: Returns value from the nth row of the window frame

name: NTILE
description: Divides partition into specified number of groups

name: PERCENT_RANK
description: Returns relative rank of current row (rank-1)/(total rows-1)

name: CUME_DIST
description: Returns cumulative distribution of current row
